publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2681 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Rural Postal Services-That the Parliament notes the decision by the Postal Services Commission to bring an end to Royal Mail's monopoly over letter deliveries; expresses its concern over the threat that this may pose to postal services in rural areas, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to do all that it can in order to ensure that these services are protected.

S1M-2681 Mr Duncan Hamilton: Rural Postal Services-That the Parliament notes the decision by the Postal Services Commission to bring an end to Royal Mail's monopoly over letter deliveries; expresses its concern over the threat that this may pose to postal services in rural areas, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to do all that it can in order to ensure that these services are protected. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Stewart Stevenson*, Irene McGugan*, Christine Grahame*, Kay Ullrich*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Robin Harper*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Richard Lochhead*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Shona Robison*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Fiona McLeod*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Colin Campbell*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Linda Fabiani*, Mary Scanlon*, Mr Keith Harding*, Mr Keith Raffan*, Brian Adam*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-2681 Rural Postal Services (lodged on 31 January 2002) Tricia Marwick*
